title: Is MKL available in the binary provided by official website
body_html:
Hi,

I installed pytorch according to the instruction in website

pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.4.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
pip3 install torchvision

torch.backends.mkl.is_available()
returns True.

But ldd shows nothing related to mkl. Is mkl built statically inside pytorch?

ldd /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffc203a6000)
	libshm.so => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so (0x00007fcd638f5000)
	libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 (0x00007fcd6368c000)
	libnvToolsExt-422e3301.so.1 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libnvToolsExt-422e3301.so.1 (0x00007fcd63482000)
	libATen.so => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libATen.so (0x00007fcd3d91d000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007fcd3d6f5000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007fcd3d4d8000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007fcd3d132000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000055dd8d325000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib64/librt.so.1 (0x00007fcd3cf2a000)
	libstdc++.so.6 => /lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007fcd3cc20000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007fcd3c920000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x00007fcd3c71c000)
	libgomp-c0d7b783.so.1 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libgomp-c0d7b783.so.1 (0x00007fcd3c4f1000)

Hi,
I installed pytorch  according to the instruction in website

pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.4.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
pip3 install torchvision

torch.backends.mkl.is_available()
returns True.
But ldd shows nothing related to mkl. Is mkl built statically inside pytorch?
ldd /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffc203a6000)
	libshm.so => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so (0x00007fcd638f5000)
	libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 (0x00007fcd6368c000)

	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007fcd3c920000)

body:
Hi,

I installed pytorch  according to the instruction in website

> pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.4.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl 
> pip3 install torchvision

`torch.backends.mkl.is_available()`
returns True.

But `ldd` shows nothing related to mkl. Is mkl built statically inside pytorch?
```
ldd /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffc203a6000)
	libshm.so => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libshm.so (0x00007fcd638f5000)
	libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libcudart-5d6d23a3.so.8.0.61 (0x00007fcd6368c000)
	libnvToolsExt-422e3301.so.1 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libnvToolsExt-422e3301.so.1 (0x00007fcd63482000)
	libATen.so => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libATen.so (0x00007fcd3d91d000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007fcd3d6f5000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007fcd3d4d8000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007fcd3d132000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000055dd8d325000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib64/librt.so.1 (0x00007fcd3cf2a000)
	libstdc++.so.6 => /lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007fcd3cc20000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007fcd3c920000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x00007fcd3c71c000)
	libgomp-c0d7b783.so.1 => /usr/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libgomp-c0d7b783.so.1 (0x00007fcd3c4f1000)
```
